intro: Rhinanthus carinthiacus, commonly known as the Carpathian rue-anemone, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its flowers are bright yellow and bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is considered a rare and declining species, making conservation efforts essential for its survival.
